creator: Robert.Wilkinson@Unisys.com
text:
A request to load a servlet on startup results in the same servlet being loaded 
and initialised twice. It appears only once in the Web.xml file in the 
context's Web-INF directory. Deleting the xml from that file results in it not 
being loaded at all. putting it back in one time results in it being loaded and 
intialised twice.

Unfortunately the servlet scans a file nightly and emails a reminder. Therefore 
this bug is resulting in a double email every night.

I am using IIS as the web server although this occurs before the web server is 
even brought up.

It can be normal for a servlet to be initialized twice.  You have eliminated
one of the ways, which is to have it in the web.xml more than once.  The other
easy way is to put the webapp that contains it under the "webapps" directory
and add a <Context ...> definition in server.xml where you specify a "path" that
differs from the directory name.  If AutoSetup is still present in server.xml
the servlet will be served in a Context based on the directory name of the
webapp, and will also be served in a Context you manually specified in the
server.xml.  This will result in two instances of the servlet being initialized.

I'm going to go ahead and resolve it as "invalid", since there isn't enough
info to determine if it is a bug or a config error.  If it is a bug it wouldn't
be fixed in Tomcat 3.1 since no support is occurring there.  If it is still
a problem in Tomcat 3.2.2 or Tomcat 3.3, please log a new bug.
